business.headline: India's growth lies in its heartland: Adani Enterprises Director Pranav AdaniThe remarks came as part of a broader statement of intent from the newly launched Chintan Research Foundation, which Adani said would focus on three critical areas: climate change, trade, and geopolitics.

Sensex ends 1,046 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Bharti Airtel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,046.30 points to end at 82,408.17, while the NSE Nifty50 added 319.50 points to close at 25,112.40.

Is lifestyle inflation fuelling debt among India's middle class?Lifestyle inflation is no longer a silent threat. It is reshaping how India's middle class earns, spends and saves. It fuels debt, shrinks buffers and puts long-term financial goals at risk.

Planning to retire at 40? Here's what it really takesThe idea of retiring at 40 sounds almost rebellious. Stop working just when most people are hitting their career peak, and live the rest of your life on your own terms. No bosses, no Monday blues, no waiting for the weekend. But can you do it?

CA explains how Rs 80,000 per month income can beat Rs 2 lakhThe CA's insights suggest that intentional financial management is key to wealth building. A clear financial purpose can transform how resources are allocated, leading to sustainable growth.

Sensex jumps over 1,100 points: Why is the stock market rising today?The primary catalyst for this rally was the RBI's announcement concerning infrastructure financing. The central bank has implemented new norms that relax provisioning requirements for under-construction infrastructure projects.

Power Finance Corporation share price jumps 6% today. Here's whyWhile PFC has faced some pressure in recent months, with its stock falling 9.14% in the last six months and 14.44% over the past year, Friday's gain marks a strong rebound following the regulatory update.
Sensex opens 228 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Nestle gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 160.43 points to 81,522.30, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,829.70 as of 9:23 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market open higher? Check key levelsAs of 8:00 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,800. This suggests that the Nifty50 may open near its previous closing level of 24,793.25.

Stocks to watch today: Oswal Pumps, Biocon, United Spirits, Sai Life SciencesShares of Nestle India could be in focus after the company announced that its Board of Directors will meet on June 26. They will consider a proposal to issue bonus shares.

Indian funds in Swiss banks triple, banking routes see sharpest surgeIndian funds in Swiss banks surged over threefold to CHF 3.5 billion (Rs 37,600 crore) in 2024, mainly due to a massive rise in holdings through financial institutions and banking channels. However, customer deposits rose by just 11%, making up only one-tenth of the total funds, which remain under tax scrutiny despite regular data sharing with Indian authorities.

Oil prices stable, situation not alarming: Union Minister amid Middle East tensionsUnion Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri allayed concerns about a spike in oil prices amid the Israel-Iran conflict, saying the situation was manageable and energy rates were under control.

entertainment.headline: Lizzo opens up about her weight-loss journey, admits to using OzempicPop star Lizzo broke her silence on the rumours surrounding her weight-loss journey. She admitted to using Ozempic and other drugs to reduce weight.

This is golden time of cinema: Chunky Pandey on changing times in film industryVeteran actor Chunky Pandey reflected on the shift towards detailed preparation and scientific approach in filmmaking. He called it the golden era of cinema with diverse platforms offering new opportunities for actors across India.

BLACKPINK's Jennie cries for help on HotOnes, says Jisoo should've done itK-pop star Jennie recently appeared on the popular YouTube show 'HotOnes' by First We Feast. During the episode, she was seen calling for help and joking that Jisoo should have taken her place instead.

Anupam Kher says DDLJ wouldn't work if released in 2025Actor Anupam Kher shares his views on how love stories in films have changed over time. He believes 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' would not resonate if released for the first time in 2025 due to shifting societal values.

Detective Sherdill review: No mystery in this murder mystery led by Diljit DosanjhReleased-Thu Jun 19, 2025Detective Sherdill movie review: A charming Diljit Dosanjh closes the murder case, and also your curiosity - long before the credits roll. The film is streaming on Zee5.

Miley Cyrus says she was blamed for father Billy smoking pot on Hannah Montana setMiley Cyrus has opened up about the real reason behind the marijuana use on the Hannah Montana set. She revealed that it was her father, Billy Ray Cyrus, who smoked pot, not her as many believed.

Maltie's schedule is crazier: Priyanka Chopra on daughter's school lifePriyanka Chopra recently opened up about her daughter Malti's school routine and how she juggles parenting while traveling for her professional commitments in India.

Johnny Depp surprises children as Captain Jack Sparrow in Madrid hospitalJohnny Depp returned to his iconic role as Captain Jack Sparrow to visit terminally ill children at a hospital in Madrid. The actor's selfless act has won hearts worldwide, showcasing his kindness beyond the screen.

Is this Gen Z: Sudhanshu Pandey on Apoorva Mukhija disrespecting Ashish VidyarthiActor Sudhanshu Pandey called out Apoorva Mukhija for disrespecting Ashish Vidyarthi on 'The Traitors'. He mentioned the lack of respect among the younger generation towards elders.

Emotional Dhanush watches Kuberaa with director Sekhar Kammula in Chennai. WatchDhanush, his son Lingaa, father Kasthuri Raja and director Sekhar Kammula watched 'Kuberaa' in Chennai. The actor turned emotional as fans cheered for him.

In my head I am married: Diana Penty on 12-year relationship with Harsh SagarActor Diana Penty recently opened up about her relationship with Harsh Sagar. She confessed that they have been committed for over 12 years, and she considers herself 'married in her head.'

Kuberaa review: Compelling premise meets conventional end in Dhanush's filmReleased-Fri Jun 20, 2025Kuberaa movie review: Director Sekhar Kammula's 'Kuberaa', starring Dhanush, Nagarjuna and Jim Sarbh, is an intriguing story about power, money and justice. The crime drama grabs your attention right from the get-go, only to have a conventional ending.

Tejasswi Prakash on not working with boyfriend Karan Kundrra: We're too expensiveActor Tejasswi Prakash said that she and her actor-boyfriend Karan Kundrra are 'too expensive' together, which is why they haven't worked on a project yet. The couple met on the sets of Bigg Boss 15 and fell in love.

Drake loses $8 million in sports gambling: Hope I can post a big winRapper Drake, an active sports gambler, recently revealed that he lost $8 million in a single month. The rap superstar had earlier placed a $750,000 bet on Royal Challengers Bangalore in this year's Indian Premier League final.

Actor Madhoo on Deepika's exit from Spirit: Would've stayed if she really wanted itActor Madhoo Shah reacted to Deepika Padukone's exit from Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Spirit'. She said it was her personal choice and not something to debate about.

Suchitra Krishnamoorthi apologises for fake post on Ahmedabad plane crash survivorActor Suchitra Krishnamoorthi faced backlash for questioning the survival story of Vishwas Kumar Ramesh, the lone survivor of the Ahmedabad plane crash. She later deleted the post and issued a public apology, admitting she had shared unverified information.

Ram Kapoor reacts to rumoured rift with Ekta Kapoor: She can say what she wantsRam Kapoor has addressed rumours of a fallout with Ekta Kapoor. He chose gratitude over conflict and called her the one who believed in him when no one else did. He also clarified that his wife Gautami's post was light-hearted and all in good fun.

Anupam Kher in shock as Robert De Niro attends Tanvi The Great premiere in New YorkActor Anupam Kher was over the moon after Hollywood legend Robert De Niro attended the New York premiere of his film 'Tanvi The Great'. Kher described the moment as one of the biggest highlights of his career.

Ram Charan-Upasana's daughter Klin Kaara meets her namesake tigress on 2nd birthdayActor Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela's daughter Klin Kaara celebrated her second birthday in a thoughtful manner on Friday. To mark the occasion, Klin met her namesake Tiger at Hyderabad zoo for the first time.

general news.headline: Thank you, but...: What PM said on turning down Trump's US visit invitePrime Minister Narendra Modi turned down Donald Trump's offer to visit United States because he "needed to return to the land of sacred Mahaprabhu."

Iran reopens skies for Indian evacuation; 1,000 nationals to land in Delhi tonightIran, which has closed its airspace amid ongoing cross-border strikes with Israel, has opened the same to allow evacuations of Indian nationals. With this, around 1000 Indian nationals are expected to arrive in New Delhi tonight.

1st Test Day 1 LIVE: Onus on Gill, Jaiswal to calm nerves in dressing roomEngland (ENG) vs India (IND), 1st Test Day 1 Live Score and Updates from Leeds: India have given away their advantage right at the end of the first session as KL Rahul and Sai Sudharsan have been dismissed within a space of six deliveries. Earlier, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rahul got the team off to a terrific start, adding 91 runs for the first wicket.

Atmanirbhar Europe? France's Macron pushes for Rafale as alternative to US jetsWhile Macron did not elaborate on the post, it is being viewed as an outreach to European countries to strengthen collective defence by buying European military hardware and reducing dependence on US tech.

Khamenei's fatwa against nukes: Did Iran sell a lie to the world?More than two decades ago, Hassan Rouhani, a top Iranian negotiator, told global powers that Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, had issued a fatwa against nuclear weapons. Rouhani later admitted that the idea came to him during the 2004 talks. Amid the Israel-Iran conflict over nukes, a look at if the fatwa exists or is a bid at deception.

Rain of lies, hail of false promises: Lalu Yadav's weather forecast on PM's visitAs Prime Minister Narendra Modi attacked the RJD-Congress combine during his visit to Bihar, RJD chief Lalu Yadav jabbed at the former, saying there was a "rain of lies" and a "hail of false promises" in the state.

Shashi Tharoor a no-show: Kerala Congress rejects 'not invited to campaign' claimKerala Pradesh Congress Committee chief Sunny Joseph said Shashi Tharoor was included in the party's star campaigner list for the Nilambur bypoll and blamed his absence on other commitments abroad. This comes a day after Tharoor claimed he wasn't invited to campaign.

Did they give us water? Omar Abdullah rejects canal idea to divert water to PunjabSpeaking about India reportedly constructing a canal to divert excess water from three western rivers of the Indus system in J&K to Haryana, Punjab and Rajasthan, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah cited the 45-year-old Shahpur Kandi barrage dispute with Punjab and asked, "Did they give us water?"
Brad Pitt wears India on his sleeve, literallyIn a behind-the-scenes photo from the F1 shoot, Brad Pitt is seen effortlessly pulling off a Tangaliya shirt by Indian label 11.11/Eleven Eleven.

President Murmu moved to tears as visually impaired students wish her on birthdayPresident Droupadi Murmu was moved to tears when students from the National Institute of the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities sang a song to wish her on her birthday.

Nurturers of mafia raj, gunda raj: PM's all-out attack on RJD-Congress in BiharIn his fifth visit to the state in the past five months, PM Modi appealed to the public to vote out those who brought 'jungle raj' to Bihar and looted the state.

9 Air India flights cancelled today, one grounded after bird hit en route PuneAir India cancelled nine flights, including one from Delhi to Pune due to a bird hit, and eight others due to enhanced maintenance and operational reasons.

Sitaare Zameen Par review: Aamir Khan's film is a warm hug, laughter pill for soulReleased-Fri Jun 20, 2025Sitaare Zameen Par movie review: With 'Sitaare Zameen Par', Aamir Khan doesn't just return to the screens, he returns you to yourself, one heartfelt laugh at a time.

CBI case against Tata Consulting Engineers, others in Rs 800-crore project fraudThe CBI has registered a corruption case against the project director of Tata Consulting Engineers Limited, the chief manager of the Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (JNPT) and others for allegedly causing wrongful loss to the tune of around Rs 800 crore in contracts.

Sensex jumps over 1,100 points: Why is the stock market rising today?The primary catalyst for this rally was the RBI's announcement concerning infrastructure financing. The central bank has implemented new norms that relax provisioning requirements for under-construction infrastructure projects.

Come, kill me, Uddhav Thackeray dares rivals. Shinde Sena says already finishedUddhav Thackeray, speaking at an event on the 59th foundation day of the Shiv Sena, accused the Eknath Shinde camp of attempting to destroy the 'Thackeray brand'.

Gavaskar, Sachin, Dravid or Kohli: Who's India's best? Sherlock Holmes investigatesCricket meets mystery in this puzzle for the ages. Virat Kohli has just retired from Test cricket and touched off a debate on who's the best Test batter ever from the short list of Gavaskar, Tendulkar, Dravid and Kohli. It's a debate wrapped inside a mystery that has layers and layers of facts, data and emotions. So, the writer summons the Sherlok Holmes inside him to crack Open the case of the #FabFourDebate.

16 billion passwords allegedly leaked in massive data breachA massive data breach has exposed over 16 billion passwords online, making it one of the biggest security leaks in internet history.

Live: Israel vows to intensify attacks after Iranian missile hits hospitalIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel and Iran continued to launch several missiles at each other as their conflict stretched into its eighth day. Israel claims it conducted overnight airstrikes in Tehran, targeting missile production sites and Iran's alleged nuclear weapons research headquarters. The attack comes as Iran appoints a new intelligence chief for the Revolutionary Guards following the killing of his predecessor in a strike last week, according to state media. Meanwhile, the White House said Trump will decide within two weeks on possible US military action against Iran, indicating that diplomacy remains an option for now. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Sudharsan makes Test debut, joins Virat Kohli and Sourav Ganguly in unique listENG vs IND: Young top-order batter Sai Sudharsan was rewarded for his outstanding IPL form as he became the latest Indian cricketer to make his Test debut in the series opener against England.

Ploy to trick Iran or diplomatic move? Behind Trump's 2-week war deadlineIran-Israel Conflict: Unpredictable as he is, Donald Trump's move has sparked speculation if the deadline was a carefully thought-out ploy to hoodwink Iran and get it to let its guard down or genuinely give diplomacy a chance.

Indian-American professor blames reservation for Air India crash, faces backlashAn Indian-American professor sparked outrage after she linked the recent Air India crash in Ahmedabad to reservation policy in India. Sharing a snippet of a job ad for air traffic controllers, she criticised the quota for certain castes. Many condemned her for the casteist and insensitive post.

sports.headline: Sai Sudharsan first Indian batter in 14 years to bag duck in maiden Test knockEngland vs India: B Sai Sudharsan was dismissed for a duck in his maiden Test innings against England at Headingley. India lost two quick wickets towards the end of the first session after England bowlers were made to toil.

Jacob Bethell, Sam Cook to leave England squad after India Test snub: ReportJacob Bethell and Sam Cook have reportedly been released from England's Test squad during the India series, following non-selection for the Headingley Test. Both will return to County Championship duty to maintain red-ball form and fitness.

How familiar are you with Ben Stokes's England? Meet the first-timers vs IndiaEngland is also in a transition of their own, with new faces set to take on the Indian team for the first time in their careers. They will look to make their mark with solid performances to give the hosts the advantage in Leeds.

ENG vs IND: Fans question IPL favouritism as Abhimanyu Easwaran gets overlookedAbhimanyu Easwaran was once again overlooked for the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds as India handed a debut to Sai Sudharsan. Easwaran has been plundering runs in domestic cricket for a number of years.

India, England players wear black armbands, mourn Air India crash victims in LeedsENG vs IND, 1st Test: England and India players were seen wearing black armbands during the Headingley Test. Both teams also observed a minute's silence as a mark of respect to those who lost their lives in the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad earlier in June.

Karun Nair back in Test side after 3006 days as cricket gives him another chanceEngland vs India: Karun Nair returned to the Test XI for the first time since March 2017. The 33-year-old was named in the XI for the first Test of the five-match series in England. B Sai Sudharsan made his Test debut for India on Friday.

After breaking 90m jinx, Neeraj Chopra eyes first win of 2025Paris Diamond League: After ending the 90-metre curse, Neeraj Chopra will be looking to secure his first title of the season when he steps onto the field for the Paris Diamond League. Neeraj will be up against a strong field that features the likes of Julian Weber, Anderson Peters among other stars.

Trinbago Knight Riders appoint Dwayne Bravo as new head coachDwayne Bravo has been appointed head coach of the Trinbago Knight Riders for the 2025 Caribbean Premier League season, marking a new chapter as TKR aims to clinch a fifth CPL title under his leadership.

Sudharsan or Easwaran: Ex-cricketers back experience over potentialFormer cricketers Mohammed Kaif and WV Raman have backed experienced domestic stalwart Abhimanyu Easwaran to start in the upcoming Test series in England, citing his consistent performances over the years in domestic cricket as a stronger case for selection compared to the promise shown by someone like Sai Sudharsan.

Life has come full circle: Karun Nair ready for Test comeback in England seriesA matured and improved Karun Nair will look to make use of the learnings from his grind in the domestic setup as he aims to impress in the upcoming Test series against England. He reflected on how he was dropped from the side and ended up making a comeback in England, the place where he was last with the Test team in 2018.

Can Mohammed Siraj lead India's attack amid Jasprit Bumrah workload concerns?A renaissance in the IPL and prior success in England have primed Mohammed Siraj to take on a leadership role in a new-look Indian team. With Jasprit Bumrah's workload being carefully managed, the 31-year-old is set to play a key role as the constant in India's bowling line-up during the England tour.

OTD: Rahul Dravid, Virat Kohli and Sourav Ganguly make Test debuts for IndiaJune 20 marks a special date in Indian cricket history — the day three stalwarts of the game began their journeys in Test cricket. Sourav Ganguly, Rahul Dravid, and Virat Kohli all took their first steps in the longest format of the game on this day.

Tim Paine reveals appointment as Australia A coach for Sri Lanka seriesFormer Test captain Tim Paine has announced his appointment as head coach of Australia A. The former wicketkeeper-batter is expected to play a key role in grooming the next generation of talent destined for the senior national team.

Jofra Archer desperate for England Test return, says captain Ben StokesEngland captain Ben Stokes has said that Jofra Archer is "absolutely desperate" to reignite his Test career and is targeting a return to red-ball cricket during the forthcoming five-match series at home against India.

Club World Cup: Vintage Messi leads Inter Miami's win vs Porto, Botafogo stuns PSGLionel Messi showed that class is well and truly permanent with a magical free-kick to give Inter Miami a historic win over FC Porto. Botafogo followed it up with the stunning upset over PSG, while Atletico Madrid returned to winning ways with a 3-1 win over Seattle Sounders.

What is Bazball and should India be scared of it?England's fearless Bazball approach, pioneered by Brendon McCullum and Ben Stokes, has redefined modern Test cricket. Now, Shubman Gill's young Indian side faces the stern test of taking on this aggressive English outfit at Headingley.

Jannik Sinner's Halle defence over after shocking loss to Alexander BublikWorld No.1 Jannik Sinner was stunned by Alexander Bublik 3-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the second round at the Halle grass-court tournament on Thursday.

Neeraj Chopra Paris Diamond League 2025 Live Streaming: When and where to watch?Neeraj Chopra, Paris Diamond League 2025: Reigning world champion Neeraj Chopra is set to compete in the Paris Diamond League 2025 on June 20 (June 21 IST), marking his second appearance of the season after Doha. In Doha, Neeraj broke the elusive 90m barrier for the first time with a throw of 90.23m, surpassing his previous best of 89.94m.

Australia drop Labuschagne, rule out Smith for 1st Test vs West IndiesAustralia have dropped Marnus Labuschagne and will be without star batter Steve Smith due to injury for the opening Test against the West Indies, beginning on 25 June in Barbados.

1st Test Leeds Weather forecast: Will rain play spoilsport in series opener?India and England are set to kick off their 2025–27 World Test Championship campaign with the first of five Tests at Headingley, Leeds, starting June 20. While anticipation is high for the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy opener, all eyes will be on the skies, with typical English weather raising concerns over possible rain interruptions on the opening day.

India need their Spidey to lead: Rishabh Pant's test of maturity beginsRishabh Pant, India's beloved 'Spidey', steps into a leadership-heavy Test series with a fresh mantle. As Shubman Gill takes charge, India need Pant to evolve from chaos creator to steady saviour in their post-Kohli, Rohit red-ball era.

New era. No mercy. Trial by Bazball awaits Shubman Gill's new-look IndiaEngland vs India, 1st Test preview: Shubman Gill will lead a new-look Indian side at Headingley, facing the daunting task of challenging a Bazballing England in their own backyard. The transition has been swift, offering no time to ease in. Can the young Indian side spring a surprise in Leeds?

Pathum Nissanka 187 leads Sri Lanka's solid response after Bangladesh post 495Pathum Nissanka's sublime 187 lit up the third day in Colombo as Sri Lanka closed in on Bangladesh's total, keeping hopes alive for a strong comeback in the opening Test of the series.

ENG vs IND, Headingley Test: All you need to know about Gill era's debutENG vs IND: India and England begin a high-stakes five-Test series at Headingley, as Shubman Gill steps into leadership and Bazball faces its first home challenge against India after a crushing 4-1 defeat away earlier this year.

Solid in defence: New captain Gill quietly confident in England Test presserIndia tour of England: Speaking to the press for the first time as India's Test captain in England, Shubman Gill exuded quiet confidence. He offered just enough of a glimpse into his mindset to intrigue, but remained guarded while addressing tricky questions in Leeds on Thursday, June 19.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
